Record Class Coordinates

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
related_to_the_collection.Coordinates
public record Coordinates(Long x, Float y) extends Record
Represents coordinates (x, y) for a study group. This class includes methods for input, validation, and conversion of coordinates.

  • Constructor Summary

    Creates an instance of a Coordinates record class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Coordinates

      public Coordinates(Long x, Float y)
      Creates an instance of a Coordinates record class.
      Parameters:
      x - the value for the x record component
      y - the value for the y record component

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Coordinates object. It includes the x and y coordinates in a readable format.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      a string representation of the Coordinates object, displaying the x and y coordinates.

    • yToString

      public String yToString()
      Converts the y coordinate to a string. If the y coordinate is null, returns an empty space string.
      Returns:
      string representation of the y coordinate or an empty space if null.

    • xToString

      public String xToString()
      Converts the x coordinate to a string. If the x coordinate is null, returns an empty space string.
      Returns:
      string representation of the x coordinate or an empty space if null.

    • isRightFill

      public static boolean isRightFill(Coordinates coordinates)
      Checks if the coordinates are correctly filled (not null). Validates that both x and y coordinates are provided.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - the Coordinates object to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are not null, false otherwise.

    • input

      public static Coordinates input() throws RemoveOfTheNextSymbol
      Prompts the user to input the coordinates (x and y). Uses the PrimitiveDataTransform class to read and validate the input.
      Returns:
      a new Coordinates object with the user-input values.
      Throws:
      RemoveOfTheNextSymbol - if the input contains invalid or unexpected symbols.
      EmptyLine - if the input is empty and not allowed.

    • inputFromFile

      public static Coordinates inputFromFile(String x, String y)
      Creates a Coordinates object from file input. Uses PrimitiveDataTransform to read and convert the x and y values from the file.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate value as a string.
      y - the y coordinate value as a string.
      Returns:
      a new Coordinates object with the values from the file, or null if the values are invalid.

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      hashCode in class Record
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
